Title:
Two new Gloeoporus (Polyporales, Basidiomycota) from tropical
China
Abstract:
Two new Gloeoporus species, G. citrinoalbus and G.
hainanensis spp. nov., are described based on morphological and
molecular characters. Gloeoporus citrinoalbus is characterized by the
lemon yellow pore surface and white margin of the fresh fruiting body,
tiny pores (810 per mm), a monomitic hyphal system with clamped
generative hyphae, presence of gloeocystidia, and allantoid
basidiospores measured as 3.84.1 × 0.81 µm. Gloeoporus hainanensis is
characterized by white to cream pore surface, tiny pores (911 per mm), a
monomitic hyphal system with simple septate hyphae, and allantoid
basidiospores measured as 3.74.7 × 0.91.1 µm. Both morphological
characters and phylogenetic analysis inferred from ITS and nLSU
sequences confirmed the placement of the two new species in Gloeoporus
and showed their relationships with similar species in the genus.
